content.description: This is the bolt line immediately left of Fear and Loathing. Another technical face climb with a finish through an intimidating roof. You can skip the roof and finish early at the Fear and Loathing Anchors, but this makes it a 5.9+.

A hidden low angle finger crack that has two possible starts. Salt is the left variation that goes at 5.9, and Pepper is the right variation that goes at 5.8. Finish at the bolted anchors for chalk board.
content.location: Walk downhill to the left of Chalk Board and look for two short corners to the right of Fear of the Gumby

content.description: A fun crack that zags back and forth across the face. This is just to the left of the Self Potential line. Shares an anchor with Fear and Loathing.
content.protection: Medium cams and nuts, and a quickdraw wouldn't hurt as the highest bolt on Fear and Loathing is near the top of this route.

content.description: (Tip of the hat to "Lichen or Leave It" at Seneca)This is an adventure climb. The whole climb is covered in large flakey lichen and intermittent shrubs and other growth. Follow discontinuous crack system up and then diagonal left and up, then slightly right. Climb ends a bit west of the roof of Gription. Follow the path of least resistance. If you like your climbs easy and straightforward this is not your climb. The rock is extremely sharp and the lichen makes jamming and finding good holds a bit of a challenge. Not a good climb for the beginning trad leader. There is another crack to the left (shallow left facing corner) that may offer an alternative start.No anchors. Belay second up then walk off to the east back around down to the trail and down and around back to the base of the Self-Potential Wall area.
content.location: Starts at a dirty crack about 25'-30’ up and around to the left from the start of Nut Job

content.description: Starting right of Fear and Loathing, stay left of the arête and climb up the left slanting finger crack that takes good gear. When the crack ends step left and up to clip the bolt, from here make a few hard and thin moves on the face to a horizontal, the route then merges with Fear and Loathing, and finishes on the shared bolt anchor.
content.location: Just to the right of Fear and loathing, locate the single bolt roughly 25ft up.

content.description: Easy crack/dihedral. This is the rightmost climb on the wall, and will be immediately apparent upon approach. The last move to the bolts is a bit heady for a 5.5, but reach up high on the boulder for a solid hand. Shares an anchor with Fear and Loathing.
content.protection: Medium to large cams and nuts. A #2 or 3 comes in handy for the horizontal placement below the boulder with the anchor.

content.description: Technical and balancey. Follow the bolt line in the middle of the face on small flakes and crimps.
content.protection: There are three bolts, and a #1 is needed for the horizontal crack near the top.
content.location: This is the bolt line in the middle of the face, directly below the anchors.

content.description: Mixed route at the far right side of the wall. Climb easy slab to small overlap, place a mid-sized piece and step onto slightly steeper slab, passing 2 bolts to a 2 bolt anchor with rap rings.
content.protection: One mid-sized cam or tricam, 2 bolts, bolted anchor
content.location: The first route you’ll see when arriving at the Self Potential Wall, look for a slab with 2 bolts above a small overlap.

content.description: This is a short wall with two easy crack systems, and two thin and challenging sport routes that all share an anchor.
